intro: Mitracarpus felipponei, commonly known as the Socotra starfruit, is a unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant has small, elliptical leaves and produces yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study.
